publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1548 Mr Jamie McGrigor: Fisheries—That the Parliament notes the failure of the Scottish Executive to take the lead in producing an appropriate cod recovery plan for presentation as a United Kingdom submission to the European Commission; believes that this failure has led to European proposals for the North Sea which would seriously disadvantage the Scottish fishing fleet; notes that the plan, unless altered, will cause tremendous economic damage to Scotland’s fishing communities, and calls for an alternative plan, devised in co-operation with the Scottish fishing industry, to be promoted immediately, which will lead to the revival of fish stocks and ensure a long-term future for Scotland’s fishing industry. Supported by: Bill Aitken*, Nick Johnston*, Alex Fergusson*, Mr David Davidson*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr Keith Harding*, John Scott*, Mary Scanlon*, Ben Wallace*, David McLetchie*
